trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, right-click the Windows Store project, click **Set as StartUp Project**, then press the F5 key to run the Windows Store app.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, right-click the Windows Store project, click **Set as StartUp Project**, then press the F5 key to run the Windows Store app.

trans-unit.source: After the app starts, the device is registered for push notifications.
trans-unit.target: After the app starts, the device is registered for push notifications.

trans-unit.source: Stop the Windows Store app and repeat the previous step to run the Windows Phone Store app.
trans-unit.target: Stop the Windows Store app and repeat the previous step to run the Windows Phone Store app.

trans-unit.source: At this point, both devices are registered to receive push notifications.
trans-unit.target: At this point, both devices are registered to receive push notifications.

trans-unit.source: Run the Windows Store app again, and type text in **Insert a TodoItem**, and then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Run the Windows Store app again, and type text in **Insert a TodoItem**, and then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Note that after the insert completes, both the Windows Store and the Windows Phone apps receive a push notification from WNS.
trans-unit.target: Note that after the insert completes, both the Windows Store and the Windows Phone apps receive a push notification from WNS.

trans-unit.source: The notification is displayed on Windows Phone even when the app isn't running.
trans-unit.target: The notification is displayed on Windows Phone even when the app isn't running.
